The graph of <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a horizontal asymptote at <math alttext="y equals 3"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a removable discontinuity at <math alttext="x equals 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Show that <math alttext="a, equals 6"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="b equals, negative 13"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>13</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.
